layer.name: Sacrifice
layer.definition: Pour out for others with no expectation of return.

questions.text: Giving significant time to serve others (prime time, not just leftovers) is ...

answers.4: common — I sacrifice prime time for others
answers.5: central — my best time goes to serving
answers.3: moderate — I give time from surplus
answers.1: rare — my time is for my priorities

questions.text: Using my execution skill to help others accomplish their goals (not just mine) is ...

answers.4: common — I deploy my skills for others
answers.5: expected — my capacity is for serving
answers.1: rare — my capacity serves my goals

questions.text: Helping with practical tasks (moving, building, fixing) when I have my own work is ...

answers.4: common — I make time to help
answers.5: normal — showing up is what I do
answers.3: moderate — I help when I can
answers.1: rare — I focus on my responsibilities

questions.text: Showing up for others' important moments even when inconvenient is ...

answers.3: moderate — I try to be there

questions.text: Giving away my margin (extra capacity) rather than hoarding it is ...
questions.principle: Margin is for giving, not hoarding

answers.2: limited — I keep most of it

remediation.advice: Time is the one resource you can't make more of. Giving time is giving life itself. If you hoard every hour for your own advancement, you're not living sacrificially. Build margin (Layer 6) precisely so you can give it away (Layer 8).

scripture.text: Greater love has no one than this, that someone lay down his life for his friends.
